links: ArticleFoodBusinessWorking with nature to make food last longer: ApeelEdible plant-derived protection that's applied to the surface of fresh produce.
Name: Working with nature to make food last longer: Apeel
About: Apeel is a company that has come up with an innovative way to eliminate single-use shrink wrap plastic packaging on fresh fruit and veg, while at the same time tackling food waste.

links: ArticleFoodBusinessMaking new products from urban organic waste streams: De Clique“We are working towards zero-waste cities in which all residual flows are reused”
Name: Making new products from urban organic waste streams: De Clique
About: Using cycle couriers and electric vehicles, De Clique collects food by-products like coffee grounds, orange peels and other food waste from businesses.

links: ArticleBusinessEurope’s first circular economy factory for vehicles: RenaultEurope’s first dedicated circular economy factory for vehicles
Name: Europe’s first circular economy factory for vehicles: Renault
About: Renault is a pioneer of the circular economy in the automotive industry. The aim of their circular activities is to extend the life of vehicles and components, and keep materials in use, thereby reducing the use of virgin materials.

links: ArticleFashionBusinessAn open access, circular supply chain for t-shirts: TeemillTeemill is a tech-based fashion business that takes a more holistic view of the fashion...
Name: An open access, circular supply chain for t-shirts: Teemill
About: Teemill is a tech-based fashion business that takes a more holistic view of the fashion industry, designing out waste at each step of the material supply chain, applying disruptive technology to minimise overstocking, and maximise material recycling.

links: ArticleBusinessDesignDesign and business model for heavy machinery remanufacturingCaterpillar manufacture heavy machinery, and develop practices that enable greater value to be...
Name: Design and business model considerations for heavy machinery remanufacturing: Caterpillar
About: Caterpillar manufacture heavy machinery, and develop practices that enable greater value to be recovered during remanufacturing processes. The company has been able to increase profit margin whilst still producing components of the highest quality. Rather than aiming to use less material, consideration goes into creating a product that is intended to be remanufactured a number of times.

links: ArticleBusinessKeeping the molecules and materials in use: SolvayGlobal chemical company Solvay supplies high-performance plastics, polymers, fluids, and elastomers...
Name: Keeping the molecules and materials in use: Solvay
About: Science company Solvay’s circular ambitions are seen as a key tool to delivering on its ‘One Planet’ sustainability strategy. This ambitious blueprint sets out Solvay’s pathway to a 26% reduction in emissions (with a recent SBTI commitment) and 30% reduction in biodiversity pressure by 2030.

links: ArticleBusinessPioneering circularity in the healthcare industry: Royal PhilipsPhilips is a global health technology company focused on improving health and enabling better...
Name: Pioneering circularity in the healthcare industry: Royal Philips
About: Philips is a global health technology company focused on improving health and enabling better outcomes for people, from healthy living and illness prevention, to diagnosis, treatment and homecare. Philips products include large scale medical equipment, such as imaging, as well as smaller medical equipment and homecare products. Philips services support the whole spectrum of activities in the health industry. The company employs approximately 77,000 employees and generates EUR 17.8 billion sales in 2022 with sales and services in more than 100 countries.

links: ArticleFinanceBusinessThe world’s largest investor and the circular economy: BlackRockIn October 2019 BlackRock launched a circular economy public equity fund.
Name: The world’s largest investor embraces the circular economy: BlackRock
About: BlackRock is the world’s largest asset manager investing on behalf of clients – ranging from pension funds and sovereign wealth funds to family offices and individuals – in assets such as shares of publicly-listed companies, corporate and sovereign bonds, and real assets, such as infrastructure and housing.

links: ArticleBusinessPlasticsArtificial intelligence for recycling: AMP RoboticsImproving the economics of recycling using artificial intelligence
Name: Artificial intelligence for recycling: AMP Robotics
About: AMP’s artificial intelligence (AI) platform AMP NeuronTM uses cameras to scan mixed waste streams and identify the different materials. Neuron’s deep learning capability allows for continuous improvement of the identification and categorisation of paper, plastics and metals, by colour, size, shape, brand and other traits.

links: ArticleBusinessDenmark: Public procurement as a circular economy enabler
Name: Denmark: Public procurement as a circular economy enabler
About: Initiated by the Danish government, the programme aims to shift public procurement to support the transition to a circular economy. Through the partnership, members work to integrate procurement policies that emphasise circular economy criteria such as the use of non-toxic chemicals, extended product lifespan, and the cycling of biological and technical materials.

links: ArticleBusinessAddressing barriers to support business innovation
Name: Addressing barriers to support business innovation: The Netherlands
Company: Netherlands Ministry of Infrastructure and Environment
About: Many circular economy opportunities are profitable but are not realised due to non-financial barriers. The Green Deal, a joint initiative between two Dutch ministries, addresses these barriers by providing advisory support to selected innovative business initiatives.

links: ArticleBusinessFinancing the expansion of circular business modelsJLG take machines back to a dedicated reconditioning facility after their first use cycle.
Name: Financing the expansion of circular business models: JLG & DLL
About: The Need: mechanical access products such as 'cherry pickers' contain many reusable components and materials that could yield many revenue cycles.

links: ArticleBusinessCollection, refurbishment and resale of mobile phone handsetsMazuma Mobile is an online mobile phone reuse and recycling service allowing consumers to unlock...
Name: Collection, refurbishment and resale of mobile phone handsets: Mazuma Mobile
About: Mazuma Mobile is an online mobile phone reuse and recycling service allowing consumers to unlock the cash value of their mobile phones, offering same day payments. Collected handsets are refurbished by an external partner where necessary and then sold to partners in emerging markets, insurance dealers and retailers in UK.

links: ArticleBusinessBelgium: Flanders Materials ProgrammeThe Flanders Materials Programme (FMP) combines an ambitious long-term vision, a 45-item plan of...
Name: Belgium: Flanders Materials Programme
Company: Flanders Public Waste, Materials & Soil Agency
About: The Flanders Materials Programme (FMP) combines an ambitious long-term vision, a 45-item plan of concrete actions and the development of policy-relevant research. It aims to streamline the many public and private initiatives in the field of sustainable materials management into a coherent whole.

links: ArticleBusinessA Second LifeA repair programme and distribution network for defective or returned products
Name: A Second Life - returns management, parts recovery and product repairs: CoreCentrics Solutions
About: A repair programme and distribution network for defective or returned products

links: ArticleBusinessFashionPlasticsProduction of nylon yarn from waste materialsYarn producer, Aquafil has designed the ECONYL® Regeneration System, which enables Nylon 6 waste to...
Name: Production of nylon yarn from waste materials: Aquafil
About: Yarn producer, Aquafil has designed the ECONYL® Regeneration System, which enables Nylon 6 waste to be regenerated into new Nylon 6 with no loss of quality. Key to success is the Reclaiming Programme, an essential tool to facilitate a reverse supply chain and ensure reliable materials inputs.

links: ArticleBusinessBusiness-to-business asset sharingFLOOW2 is the first business-to-business sharing marketplace that enables companies and...
Name: Business-to-business asset sharing: FLOOW2
About: FLOOW2 is the first business-to-business sharing marketplace that enables companies and institutions to share overcapacity of equipment, knowledge and skills of personnel. Users can register on the platform for free and participants pay a subscription to advertise their equipment on the platform, providing a revenue stream for FLOOW2.

links: ArticleBusinessFinanceThe role of a bank in the circular economy: Intesa SanpaoloPromoting and supporting the circular economy is of primary importance to Intesa Sanpaolo and is...
Name: Embracing the circular economy at Italy’s largest bank: Intesa Sanpaolo
Company: Embracing the circular economy at Italy’s largest bank: Intesa Sanpaolo
About: Intesa Sanpaolo is an Italian international banking group. With 14.6 million customers, it is Italy’s largest bank by total assets and one of the top 30 largest in the world. Intesa Sanpaolo Group is active in Europe, Central Eastern Europe, the Middle East and North Africa, as well as the United States, Brazil, Russia, India and China.

links: ArticleBusinessCreating trust in the sharing economy: OmocomOn-demand micro-insurance for the sharing economy. The Swedish company provides insurance for hire...
Name: Creating trust in the sharing economy: Omocom
About: The Swedish company provides insurance for hire goods. But here’s the smart bit - they only insure an item while it’s being used, transported, accessed, or similar, for a short period of time. For those looking to earn extra money by listing their items on peer-to-peer platforms but worried about potential damage, Omocom has the solution.

links: ArticleBusinessMultinational companiesExamples of some of the world’s largest companies that have started to embrace the circular economy.
Name: Circular examples collection: Multinational companies

links: ArticleBiodiversityBusinessClimateCreating a regenerative economy in the Amazon ForestNatura produces a huge range of products including  soaps, creams, and shampoos, all of  which ...
Name: Creating a regenerative economy in the Amazon Forest: Natura Brazil
About: Natura is South America’s largest cosmetic company. The brand became global when it purchased the Body Shop in 2017, and most recently Avon products, making it one of the largest beauty companies in the world.

links: ArticleBusinessClimateBuilt EnvironmentCooling as a service: KaerKaer has developed an innovative business model which reduces the energy and material intensity...
Name: Cooling as a service: Kaer
About: “We’re stuck in a vicious cycle. Rising global temperatures are driving increased demand for cooling, which causes more global warming and creates the need for even more cooling. We must break this cycle and transform how we cool.”

links: ArticleBusinessA mobility revolution in WalesThe current process rewards the continual consumption of finite resources, degrades our environment...
Name: A mobility revolution in Wales: Riversimple
About: The Problem: the automobile industry relies on fast turnover, and a high throughput of materials and parts. The current process rewards the continual consumption of finite resources, degrades our environment and cannot work in the long run.

links: ArticleBusinessHow tool sharing could become a public utilityMembers have access to 7000+ high quality tools; an inspiring and creative workspace and...
Name: How tool sharing could become a public utility: Toronto Tool Library and Makerspace
About: The Challenge: Tools and other equipment have a low frequency use, but are found in many households and therefore represent a high material intensity, underutilised and space occupying item.

links: ArticleBusinessBorrow stuff you need. Lend stuff you don’t.A peer-to-peer sharing platform for technical equipment; a thriving marketplace for lenders and...
Name: Borrow stuff you need, Lend stuff you don’t: Fat Lama
About: The Need - a lot of equipment owned by individuals is used only a few hours in its lifetime. An effective sharing economy model would help realise underutilised potential.

links: ArticleBusinessCitiesBuilt EnvironmentA building that can be reused: Brummen Town HallBrummen Town Hall was designed for future reuse and modular assembly.
Name: A building that can be reused: Brummen Town Hall
About: Capturing components and materials at the end of a building’s use phase requires a conscious decision at the design stage, so that the building is seen not only as an aesthetic and functional entity, but also a future material store.

links: ArticleDesignBusinessBuilt EnvironmentWhy buy light bulbs when you can buy light? SignifySignify’s circular lighting is a completely new approach to lighting where the capital expense of...
Name: Why buy light bulbs when you can buy light? Signify
About: Signify, formerly Philips Lighting, is a multinational lighting corporation producing and selling electric lights and lighting fixtures that are installed all over the world. Signify employs almost 40,000 employees and has production facilities in over 70 countries.

links: ArticleBusinessReusing valuable resources more effectively: RheaplyRheaply enables organizations of all sizes to access a re-commerce platform for furniture,...
Name: Reusing valuable resources more effectively: Rheaply
About: Rheaply enables organisations of all sizes to access a re-commerce platform for furniture, fixtures, equipment, and building materials. By combining smart inventory management and connected nationwide marketplaces, Rheaply keeps furniture and other resources out of landfills and into the hands of people who need them.
